replies.bodyText:
Hi @sancar, I followed widely used way of configuration:

system property - useful for debug or fine tuning, overrides config file
standard config file as persistent configuration

So the final decision is to drop the system property support? It simplifies some code paths, but removes duality of configuration, which may be useful in some use cases.
replies.author: sgflt

replies.bodyText:
We are not putting configuration to both properties and config unless we have to.
And I have just learned that we applied a feature that allows you to override Config via properties anyway.
https://docs.hazelcast.org/docs/latest/manual/html-single/#overriding-configuration
So when you add it to Config, the property support is added automagically :)

replies.bodyText: Oh nice :) I am going to investigate this feature.

timeline.bodyText:
Can we add something like following into Javadoc of the set method?
This configuration should be used cautiously. Default serializers are used heavily by the hazelcast internally. 
If any of the instance in the same cluster overrides a default serializer, all the members and clients in the same cluster must override it with the same serializer. 
This configuration is introduced specifically to support the following case:
1. There was a custom configuration by the user for a type 
2. Hazelcast decided to add a default serializer for the same type in a future release.
To be able to support Rolling Upgrade from an old version to the new version, one needs to make sure of the backward compatibility of the serialization. As a solution, the user will set this property on the new version so that new instances will be able to override new default serializers with their existing custom serializers.
